title: Managing Project Teams
headline: Learn how to build and manage your project team effectively using proven strategies from this free online course.
description: In this free online course, you will learn how to help the team visualize success at the offset of the project whilst the objectives are still being conveyed. This will increase your success rate, make the project team members feel valued, and more likely to respond well to possible challenges. Also, you will learn how to close out a project and celebrate the project's success. Register for this course today and improve your career skills!

courseDescription:
A project team is a team whose members usually belong to different groups, functions and are assigned to activities for the same project. This course is a combination of new material and a more in-depth look at some key topics. It covers all the aspects that successful project managers need to learn to manage a large project team effectively. The tools and techniques taught in this course are a must-have to help complete complex projects on time with more business value. This course will help build on some interpersonal skills like the ability to understand how to effectively build a team, and how to resolve conflict in a team. You will learn about factors that drive team performance along with techniques to maintain high-performing teams through various strategies aimed at encouraging self-reflection. Regardless of the seniority or experience level of the project team members, each person needs to be totally clear and committed to achieving the project objectives. Participants in this course should have had an introductory course or project management experience.

Due to the high level of uncertainty, roles and responsibilities, changes occur more frequently, and the team needs to be flexible enough to adapt to new challenges. Due to time constraints, there is more stress working on a project caused by the inherent uncertainty of working. This applies in new areas or with new groups of stakeholders or solutions that no one has ever explored before. This course combines the essential elements of project management and team leadership into one course. In this free online course, you will acquire a further understanding of the responsibilities of leadership and become better prepared to apply this knowledge to the project environment. Upon completing this course, you will be able to: Learn about the role of high-performance teams and leadership in project management, and learn about the tools and techniques for developing and strengthening high-performance teams and team members. Also, you will learn the stages in the project cycle and how to apply best practices to develop competencies and skills in planning and controlling projects to ensure successful outcomes.

Team management includes the processes required to make the most effective use of the people involved with the project. Project teams usually consist of the project manager and the project staff who have been assigned the responsibility to handle the project. Managing a project team involves several factors that differentiate it from managing other types of staff. In the case of a project team, it has a start and an end as well as in terms of tasks assigned to the project. Also, the project team members could have diverse backgrounds, skills and experiences, and in a majority of cases they have never worked together. This course takes you through how to monitor project activities and assess progress. You will understand how to communicate proficiently to report project status and performance to stakeholders and contribute to the organizational knowledge base. The course is the best starting point to continue your knowledge of the relevant and basic skills required to manage a project and team. This course is a must-have for Project Managers. The skills taught in this course will enable the project managers to apply effective leadership strategies, improve interpersonal communications, and become more influential.

Start Course Now

Your Alison certificate is:

Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:

  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about introductory aspects of Knowing Your Team and how to identify the elements of your team. You will also learn about the key areas of interaction within a team. Additionally, you will learn about the communication process, methods and guidelines for identifying standards.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about introductory aspects of managing your team and the key areas to help effectively manage your team to make sure you have a successful project. You will also learn about how to officially close out a project.

slides:
• Learning Outcomes
  • Upon successful completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Distinguish between a primary and secondary stakeholder.
    • Define group dynamics.
    • Identify some examples of nonverbal communication cues.
    • Outline the three key areas that help you understand interaction within a team.
    • Describe what a project charter is.
    • List three guidelines on how to identify the elements of a team.
    • State three different methods of communicating within a team.
  • Knowing Your Team

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Interaction Within a Team

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Communication Within the Team

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Identifying Standards

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • A Primary stakeholder is one with the most interest in the project and most affected by the project's positive outcome while a Secondary stakeholder is one that has some level of interest in the project and is indirectly affected to some degree by the project outcome.
    • Group Dynamics are the interactions among team members of a team that are influenced by the individual identities of team members.
    • Task Roles are the various roles each member assumes for specific projects, which correlate with a specific job that must be accomplished in order to complete the task, and may change with each project.
    • There are various methods of communicating within a team. To communicate with a team, you can either use email, meeting, or any other method that works.
    • A project charter is a document that specifies the project’s purpose, its scope, and its desired outcomes.
    • Eye contact, facial expressions, and gestures are some examples of nonverbal communication cues.
    • A stakeholder is either an individual or a group that has an interest in the team’s assigned task or project, and benefits from its positive outcome.
